Package client

Class ClientRequestSender

java.lang.Object
client.ClientRequestSender
public class ClientRequestSender extends Object
This class is in charge of sending requests from the client to the server. It doesn't deal with responses at all - just sends data when asked. Think of it as the "transmitter" of the app: other controllers call it whenever they need to communicate something to the server. Example usage from any controller: client.getRequestSender().requestLogin(...);

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Details

    • requestLogin

      public void requestLogin(String username, String password) throws IOException
      Sends a login request to the server.
      Parameters:
      username - exact username (case-sensitive)
      password - plain-text password
      Throws:
      IOException - if the message cannot be sent (e.g. socket closed or network error)

      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's ID
      date - the requested reservation date
      time - the requested reservation time

      time - the requested time

      subscriberCode - the code entered by the subscriber

      Parameters:

    • isThereFreeParkingSpace

      public void isThereFreeParkingSpace(String parkingLotName, int subscriberCode)
      Sends a request to the server to check if there's at least one free space in the given parking lot. The check can depend on the subscriber's code.
      Parameters:
      parkingLotName - the name of the parking lot to check
      subscriberCode - the code of the subscriber

    • isThereReservation

      public void isThereReservation(int subscriberCode)
      Checks if the subscriber has a valid upcoming reservation.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's ID

    • sendLogout

      public void sendLogout()
      Sends a logout request to the server when the user chooses to log out. This keeps the application open but ends the session on both client and server.

    • sendExit

      public void sendExit()
      Sends an exit request to the server when the user closes the app. This is used to log the user out and shut everything down cleanly.
